You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the banana in the freezer, the book on the side table and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

Given the clarification needed for the 'search' action, let's break it down into more specific actions:

> look at living room
Next actions: Identify potential locations for book; if book is seen, pick it up and place it on side table; place plate on table; if book is not seen, move to bedroom and kitchen to continue search.

> (Assuming no book is seen in living room after looking around)
> go to bedroom
Next actions: Look around bedroom for book; if found, place it on side table; if not found, proceed to kitchen; once book and plate are placed correctly, declare completion.

> look around bedroom for book
If book is found, place it on side table. If not found, proceed to kitchen to continue search.

> (Assuming book is found in bedroom or kitchen after looking around)
> place book on side table
Next actions: Confirm all items are placed correctly; if so, declare completion.

> done

This sequence involves the player looking around the living room and bedroom for the book, placing the book on the side table if found, and placing the plate on the table. If the book is not found in these rooms, the player moves to the kitchen to continue the search. Once all items are placed correctly, the game is completed.
